Tasks Active Sync Engine Interface API
The scope of this document is to describe the existi
This document includes the Tasks UI and TasksProvider applications.
ActiveSync WAP Binary XML Protocol Specification
ActiveSync is the primary component that allows mobile devices to communicate with Exchange Server.
designed for the synchronization of email, contacts, calendar, tasks and notes
Task application supports multiple accounts for EAS sync service. Task application
the user to create update and delete task items
and also to set reminder for the tasks

Application fetches a list of exchange accounts. If there is no account configured, the application itself calls the account settings activity to configure the exchange account. User enters the existing account information (user name and password) and clicks next to configure the exchange account. On positive confirmation from the server for the given information
pplication will configure the exchange account.
is temporarily unavailable or data networking is currently unavailable show the corresponding error message to the user.
Enable / Disable Tasks Sync from Account & Sync setting
User goes to Account & Sync Settings screen in the Settings application and selects the particular account then
the Sync Tasks option from the account. Application will set false to Tasks Sync option
and not sync Task items from the server
User goes to Account & Sync Settings screen in the Settings application and selects the particular account then
the Sync Tasks option from the account. Application will manually sync with the selected
account and update the tasks database
Screenshot: Disabling Tasks Sync from Account & Sync settings [Main Success Scenario]
Tasks Sync from Account & Sync settings [Alternate Scenario]
User goes to Account & Sync Settings screen in the Settings application and selects the
account then removes the account from the device. Application will remove
account from the task database, which is related to the particular account.

Main Success Scenario Server Account Task
User creates a new task in server. Application will sync with server and update the device with the new changes in the server. User selects the

status for the task from the server and it will be synced with the device. Application will not allow the user to edit the completed task but user can delete it. Application will also remove the reminders for the completed task, if any.

Task is available in both server and device
selects the server task item from the device and edits some fields, while the user edits the same task in the server also. User saves the changes from both side (Server and device). When sync
server will confuse with the changes in both side. Server will update the task with the changes made from the server
side to avoid the conflict and sync the server data to the device.
This table stores the configured exchange account details.
This table is used to segregate the task items based on the account
if the device is configured with more than one account.
is also used to identify the task item to view, update, delete and search based on the account.

that was used to sync the entry to the device
